title: M2: MT and code-breaking
authorComments: * DIFFICULTY: elementary. * SUPERVISION: self-assessment. * ESTIMATED ANSWERING TIME: 1minute. * LANGUAGE-SPECIFIC CONTENT: none. * ADAPTATION TO OTHER LANGUAGES: not necessary. * COMMENTS FOR INSTRUCTORS: Machine translation developers often call translating "decoding" and this can confuse students. When British mathematicians "decoded" secret German military messages during the World War Two, for example, they were basically unscrambling scrambled German (or deciphering encrypted German, to put it more formally). Once the scrambled messages were unscrambled, they still have to be translated (by human translators) from German into English!
